projects.title: Interferències
authors: Daniel Verano & Pol Valverde i Valverde
description: Interferències is an immersive installation that transforms the invisible electromagnetic waves around us into a perceptible sound and light landscape. The beacons capture signals from sources like antennas, radios, or mobile devices, converting them into sound and light in real-time. Each visit is unique due to the constant interaction with the environment and visitors' devices, which can alter the landscape by generating interferences. This piece invites exploration of the invisible electromagnetic dimensions that underpin our world.
The signal-capturing device is based on the open-source project Priezor, created by LOM / Jonás Gruska, and licensed under CC BY-NC-SA. More information at LOM Audio.
In collaboration with: Lluèrnia, Festival de Llum i Foc
